data.prayer: Spirit, please give new believers a yearning to see you praised in Ali Sabieh, Djibouti.
data.verse: Declare his glory among the nations, his marvelous deeds among all peoples.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Ali Sabieh, Djibouti
data.section_summary: What people or resources could you pray for in this photo?

data.prayer: Father, you desire the people in the state of Ali Sabieh who are far from you to hear about you.
data.verse: "Those who were not told about him will see, and those who have not heard will understand."

data.prayer: Father, please send teachers of your Word in Ali Sabieh who can speak your gospel boldly and clearly.
Spirit, teach the church in the state of Ali Sabieh to increase their prayer for your kingdom to come.
data.verse: Now when Daniel learned that the decree had been published, he went home to his upstairs room where the windows opened toward Jerusalem. Three times a day he got down on his knees and prayed, giving thanks to his God...

data.prayer: Lord, you sent Jesus as a witness to testify about the light so that all the Arab, Yemeni people might believe through him.
Father, send out evangelists who will challenge people like Peter who said, "Repent and be baptized, every one of you" in the state of Ali Sabieh, Djibouti.
data.verse: Peter replied, “Repent and be baptized, every one of you, in the name of Jesus Christ for the forgiveness of your sins. And you will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit.

data.prayer: Spirit, supernaturally prepare encounters with the gospel on sites like Facebook and Instagram for the 59,800 people living in Ali Sabieh.

data.section_summary:
the state of Ali Sabieh, Djibouti has a population of 59,800.

We estimate Ali Sabieh has 82 people who might know Jesus, 1,219 people who might know about Jesus culturally, and 58,499 people who do not know Jesus.

This is 1 believer for every 729 neighbors who need Jesus.

data.prayer: Lord, raise up apostolic workers to plant churches in every town in the state of Ali Sabieh.
data.verse: The reason I left you in Crete was that you might put in order what was left unfinished and appoint elders in every town, as I directed you.
